intro: Erysimum bulgaricum, commonly known as the Bulgarian wallflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and features linear, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
